metadata.Title: CVE-2023-4911 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - high.
metadata.Description:
A buffer overflow was discovered in the GNU C Library's dynamic loader ld.so while processing the GLIBC_TUNABLES environment variable. This issue could allow a local attacker to use maliciously crafted GLIBC_TUNABLES environment variables when launching binaries with SUID permission to execute code with elevated privileges.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-4911` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.37-0ubuntu2.1
libc-bin - 2.37-0ubuntu2.1
libc6 - 2.37-0ubuntu2.1
libc6-amd64 - 2.37-0ubuntu2.1
libc6-i386 - 2.37-0ubuntu2.1
libc6-prof - 2.37-0ubuntu2.1
libc6-s390 - 2.37-0ubuntu2.1
libc6-x32 - 2.37-0ubuntu2.1
locales - 2.37-0ubuntu2.1
locales-all - 2.37-0ubuntu2.1
nscd - 2.37-0ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: alexmurray> Upstream advisory states this was introduced in April 2021 (glibc 2.34) by commit 2ed18c5b534d9e92fc006202a5af0df6b72e7aca

criterions.comment: glibc package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.37-0ubuntu2.1').
